Row.Text: Slavery: Introduction

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Slavery[ENDCOLOR] is a method of purchasing Military Units outright. These Units are often very cheap, however, they earn only 50% of the normal XP from combat. They also cost much more to upgrade.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot enslave Mechanized Units such as Tanks, Naval Units, Siege Units, or Air Units, however. You must buy these with Gold instead if you wish to rush them.

Slavery is a system whereby some people are judged far inferior to others and are treated as objects or possessions, with no more rights than those afforded to chairs or cattle. Slavery has existed as long as human history, from earliest primitive times to the enlightened days of Greece and Rome and right up until today. Sometimes convicted criminals were made into slaves. Sometimes captured enemies of the state were enslaved. Sometimes people of a specific race or coloration were enslaved. In some civilizations a person could purchase their freedom or were allotted it after being enslaved for a specific period of time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The advantage of slavery is that it allows people to be forced to do jobs that they would otherwise refuse to do without adequate compensation. Cheap labor results in concentration of wealth and thus the creation of great buildings and temples or the maintenance of large professional armies. Aside from its basic moral repugnance, the disadvantages of slavery are numerous; it corrupts both slave and master, it badly underutilizes the intelligence and creativity of the subject people, and it almost inevitably leads to revolts and internal strife.
Used by powerful Military Units and the Labourer.
Labourer

Improves [ICON_FOOD] Food [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold by constructing Improvements on map tiles outside of Cities at a faster rate than Peasants. Cannot build Roads nor Railroads and cannot repair Improvements.

The Slave builds improvements like farms and mines. It cannot defend itself, so accompany it with a military unit when it is in dangerous territory. It is faster than the Peasant, however, it cannot construct roads or railroads and cannot repair improvements. The Slave can also hurry production of a unit, building or Wonder in a city. The Slave is expended when used in either of these ways.

Slavery is the state in which one person is under the complete control of another; literally that one person is the property of another and forced to serve without the right of pay or protest. Historically, slavery was lucrative in all societies in maintaining economic stability, with three quarters of the world's population estimated to be slaves at the beginning of the 19th century, but the life of a slave was wretched. Today, slavery is outlawed in every country, following the example of the British Empire in the late 18th century, but there are an estimated 27 million people still living as slaves today; often as debt slaves, indentured servants, sex slaves, or child soldiers.

[NEWLINE]"The Europeans and Americans residing in the town of Zanzibar are either Government officials, independent merchants, or agents for a few great mercantile houses in Europe and America"[NEWLINE] - Henry Morton Stanley[NEWLINE]

Stone Town is the old part of Zanzibar City, on the Tanzanian island of Zanzibar. It is believed the first stone construction in the area began during the period in which the Sultan of Oman ruled over Zanzibar in the 18th - 19th centuries. In 1863, the Sultan of Oman moved his capital to Zanzibar, and created a lush palace complex on the island in Stone Town, and spurred the island and Stone Town into a period of rapid development. A war of sucession following the reign of one of the sultans caused Zanzibar to become an independant sultanate from Oman, leading to more development of Stone Town.
